result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Francisco Rodriguez Guerrero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $200 fine plus costs. If fine and costs are not paid in full on or before 5/28/16, stay on jail time will be lifted.

Stayed. If Defendant pays fine and costs in full on or before 5/28/16, stay will be permanent. If Defendant fails to pay fine and costs in full on or before 5/28/16, stay will be lifted. Good time and Huber privileges granted. 60 days from sentencing date to report.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Francisco Rodriguez Guerrero

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Juan Francisco Rodriguez Guerrero in court with attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reme Bashi appeared as interpreter, sworn. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.

Attorney Luca Lopes Fagundes in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that he was retained yesterday, requests to proceed without Defendant, will get authorization filed within 48 hours. Defense enters not guilty plea, requests status conference. Court reviews bond.  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Juan Francisco Rodriguez Guerrero in court, in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Susan Rascon appeared as interpreter by phone. Greg Gerbers appeared by phone. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel. Discussion regarding underlying case. Underlying sentence to be served forthwith, with credit from time he was picked up. Atty Gerbers believes Defendant will not qualify if still employed at Marinette Marine. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
